body: I'm not clear where a 0x0 image is useful. Can you explain the usecase?

The same way the number [zero](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Identity_element) is useful in mathematics. It acts as an additive identity, and is key to defining a [Group](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Group_(mathematics)) (here, in the image space). This helps if you are stitching images together - which has obvious uses. Also like @manthey mentioned, when you crop (subtract) an image from itself, it results in the zero image. Hence denying a zero is not mathematically consistent, and will result in bugs. 
Lack of zero becomes a serious problem if you are using functional programming tools like fold/reduce to add a bunch of images. The presence of zero lets one use those tools out of the box (thanks to duck-typing in Python).

I have two code paths that handle certain image operations.  One has a crop step that can result in a 0 x 0 image.  The other has a condition where if a certain condition is not met, I have no image data, but I have a band specification.  Both these paths then can optionally create a larger image that has the same color bands as this image.  Originally I had an output step where these paths come together and was creating a 0 x 0 image in the second condition to indicate that there would be no image data.  This was handier than passing a special value, as the image maintains the color band information for the later step.

issue.title: Fix division by zero when creating 0x0 image from numpy array
issue.body:
Fixes #2259.

Changes proposed in this pull request:

 * Avoid [division by zero](https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/blob/badc3ec1f37096ebf959524b4bcf2c14db2d7936/map.c#L345) when creating a 0x0 image from a numpy array: `stride` is zero
 * Add test case using numpy
 * Update an error message from #2262

body: This is caused by a [division by zero](https://github.com/python-pillow/Pillow/blob/badc3ec1f37096ebf959524b4bcf2c14db2d7936/map.c#L345). Here's a PR with a numpy test case to fix it: #2419.

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**

`OS-image/get-data` doesn't have any zero handle checks:
https://github.com/red/red/blob/7d01c85e84c208e6b64544bde295e90733eb21c0/runtime/platform/image-gdiplus.reds#L306-L317

and usually receives the result of `OS-image/lock-bitmap-fmt` which in case of any error returns *zero*:
https://github.com/red/red/blob/7d01c85e84c208e6b64544bde295e90733eb21c0/runtime/platform/image-gdiplus.reds#L266-L280

In effect, when image is empty, I'm having crashes from calling [`image/acquire-buffer`](https://github.com/red/red/blob/7d01c85e84c208e6b64544bde295e90733eb21c0/runtime/datatypes/image.reds#L16) in R/S code, or from using `sort`:
```
i: make image! 0x0
sort reduce [i i]
```
